intro: Craspedia glauca var. glabrata, commonly known as the glabrous blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while the stems are usually upright and branching. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is adapted to dry, well-drained conditions.
